description: News, reaction and information about the impact of coronavirus on Jersey.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates 4-7 May
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates 4-7 May - BBC News
maintext:
Jersey's chief minister has warned that islanders who disregard lockdown measures during Liberation weekend could delay the relaxing of restrictions.
"Nothing has changed for this weekend", Senator Le Fondre said.
"If it looks like it's gone completely out of control, then there is always a risk that we would have to reassess where we were."
He said he hoped islanders continued to look forward to the celebrations.
"May the ninth is a time for celebration as well as reflection. It is a celebration of the community spirit and hope that kept people going until the joyous day they were liberated.
"That spirit of liberation still abides in Jersey today and I hope we can all draw strength and inspiration from that, this weekend, in the circumstances we face."
